abstract: Jury selection begins in New York State Supreme Court trial of Pedro Hernandez, man accused of murdering 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979; defense lawyers and prosecution both say selection may take weeks and Judge Maxwell Wiley warns potential jurors that trial could be as long as three months.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Hernandez is accused of killing the 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979. Opening statements are expected to start on Jan. 20.
snippet: Pedro Hernandez is accused of killing the 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979. Opening statements are expected to start on Jan. 20.

headline.main: Jury Selection Begins in Patz Murder Case
headline.print_headline: Jury Selection Begins for Man Charged in Patz Murder Case
